events.description: Gold rose for a third consecutive session to approximately $4,970 per ounce.
President Trump nominated Kevin Warsh as the next Federal Reserve chair.
Release of private payroll data showing weaker-than-expected growth.
Release of services sector data showing an upside surprise.
Agreement to hold nuclear talks despite ongoing tensions.

facts.fact_text: Gold rose to around $4,970 per ounce on Thursday.

evidences.evidence_text: Gold rose to around $4,970 per ounce on Thursday, extending gains for a third straight session

facts.fact_text: President Trump nominated Kevin Warsh as the next Fed chair.

evidences.evidence_text: particularly after President Trump nominated Kevin Warsh as the next Fed chair.

facts.fact_text: The ADP employment report showed weaker-than-expected private payroll growth.

evidences.evidence_text: Attention focused on the ADP employment report, which showed weaker-than-expected private payroll growth

facts.fact_text: US government data has been delayed.

evidences.evidence_text: Meanwhile, with key US government data delayed, markets placed greater weight on private indicators

claims.claim_text: The rise in gold prices was driven by dip buying following a historic pullback.

evidences.evidence_text: The move was driven by dip buying following a historic pullback from record highs late last week.

claims.claim_text: The ISM services PMI indicates resilience in the services sector.

evidences.evidence_text: an upside surprise in the ISM services PMI pointed to resilience in the services sector.

claims.claim_text: Markets are using private indicators to gauge the Fed's outlook due to government data delays.

evidences.evidence_text: markets placed greater weight on private indicators to gauge the economy and the Federal Reserve’s outlook

evidence.evidence_text: markets placed greater weight on private indicators to gauge the economy and the Federal Reserve’s outlook, particularly after President Trump nominated Kevin Warsh as the next Fed chair.
Attention focused on the ADP employment report, which showed weaker-than-expected private payroll growth
an upside surprise in the ISM services PMI pointed to resilience in the services sector.
Elsewhere, US–Iran tensions lingered despite an agreement to hold nuclear talks in Oman on Friday
